alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Kent; Queen Anne's; Talbot (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 12:23AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A line of strong showers will impact portions of New Castle, northwestern Kent, Talbot, eastern Queen Anne`s, Caroline, northeastern Kent, Salem, northwestern Camden, northwestern Gloucester, southwestern Philadelphia and southeastern Delaware Counties through 130 AM EST... At 1222 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers with little, if any, thunder and lightning, along a line extending from Talleyville to Lusby. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Camden, Wilmington, Dover, Middletown, Easton, Gloucester City, Chester, Deptford, West Deptford, Pennsville, Bellmawr, Woodbury, Smyrna, Carneys Point, Folcroft, Elsmere, Paulsboro, New Castle, and Penns Grove. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 1 and 2. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 19. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 9 and 23. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 349 and 351. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 25. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 2. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 0. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
